com.server.factory.classes

Class DebugServerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.server.factory.classes.DebugServerListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class DebugServerListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listener
    This class is responsible for listening for input from a client. It will add received commands to the scheduler.
    Author:
    Stephen Patel

                   java.net.Socket in,
                   java.net.Socket out)

        Parameters:
        s - the state to initialize commands with.
        in - the socket to read from.
        out - the socket to write to.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Upon initialization, this listener requests player info from the user. If the player name received back is already in use, then it will request player info again, otherwise the player specified by the user will be created. Listens for commands from the client. When received, these commands are reinitialized, and scheduled.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
